name: CN Tower
fact: At 553 meters (1,815 ft), one of the tallest free-standing structures in the world

name: Casa Loma
fact: Only full sized castle in North America consisting of Edwardian decor, secret passageways, and elaborately decorated rooms

name: City Hall
fact: One of the city's most distinctive landmarks, with the public space Nathan Phillips Square in front

name: Dundas Square
fact: The city's newest and flashiest public square

name: Toronto Islands
fact: These islands form part of the largest car-free urban communities in North America

name: Hockey Hall of Fame
fact: Hall of Fame and museum holding exhibits about players, teams, NHL records, memorabilia and the Stanley Cup

name: Toronto Public Library
fact: With 12 million items and 100 branches, it is one of the largest neighbourhood-based library systems in the world

name: Caribana
fact: The Toronto Caribbean Carnival is billed as North America's largest street festival
